item.title: iPad and friends
item.description: It’s been a year since I sold my kidneys for an iPad. It’s been fun. It has replaced every other device I own (ie, a couple of PCs and the nexus one). It’s an outright winner, when it comes to reading, especially long-form articles, and books alike. It has become my go-to machine for everyday news, twitter/facebook, and even for browsing my favorite photographers. It have however remained strictly in the realm of content consumption – until now.

item.title: iCaved
item.description: I did it. I said I wouldn’t. I said I will hold out for purely ethical reasons, but it is very hard to resist the iPad. The first impression in-store is simply – awesome. This of course is not a surprise and is something that one can expect from apple these days. Warning: This is a long post .. Here are some thoughts, after a day of use: It’s fast.

item.title: OPML Editor as a wordpress editor
item.description: This is a test post to see if Dave Winer’s OPML editor works with a self-hosted wordpress blog. There is something geeky about seeing crappy fonts on a screen, that makes one want to use a tool more. I’ve known of the OPML editor for a few years now, and have tried several times to find a neat use-case for it in my workflow, and it never had a compelling enough reason for me to stick with it.

item.title: Guess what I'm getting in a week or two?!
item.description: I’ve been waiting for this for a while now! Gary I hope it is all that I expect it to be. If I don’t read this the day I get it, and jump up from my bed at 2 AM crying “crush it” … well … I bet I will.

item.title: In the browser lies the power - Wave 2 of the Google takeover
item.description: Finally it’s out in the open. The ultimate weapon in Google’s powerchest to combat desktop applications, render the need for a specific platform meaningless - the browser. I guess this has been in the making for the last decade, and here it is. A browser by a company that downloads pretty much most of the internet every day. If you are still reading this, you shouldn’t be. Get outta here and read this.

item.title: A web based writer for writing to a blog?!
item.description:
WriteToMyBlog.com, is a web-based editor (with a lot of formatting options), that allows you to write to your blog (from another website?!). First thoughts go like, “wtf?!”, … “hmmm.. interesting”… “I am a web 2.0 junkie?!
The likes 1. Simplicity of the UI interface - neat, allows lots of space for text 2. Integration of Flickr and Youtube (although I would love to see more such services) 3. Zero account creation overhead.

item.title: Jott - a voice-based blog client!
item.description: Well, this is a first post to my blog using Jott, which is a very cool service. It allows you to call a number and talk what you want to post, and post it to your blog. I think it’s one of the new tools that really enable blogging. I’m just going to try it and see how it works out. listen Powered by Jott
